1Component selector
The component selector allows you to build and retrieve user defined
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.html#component components for use in your project.
/images/eiffelbuild/screenshots/component_selector.png
2Creating a component
To define a new
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.html#component component ,
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.html#pick_and_drop pick the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.html#object object that you wish to create the component from, and then
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.html#pick_and_drop drop it anywhere in the component selector. The following dialog will appear:
/images/eiffelbuild/screenshots/component_namer.png
Modify the suggested name as desired, and then click OK to create the new component. If you click Cancel, the component will not be created.
The component that has been created will contain enough information to allow a copy to be built of the existing object. This includes all the children of the original object (to any depth) and the properties (width, height, color etc)of all objects within the structure. The only properties of the objects that will not be set inside a component are the user defined names, and any events connected to the objects.
2Using a component To create a new set of
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.html#object objects from a
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.html#component component ,
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.html#pick_and_drop pick the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.html#component component , and
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.html#pick_and_drop drop onto an
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.html#object object representation. If an object is full, or does not allow other objects of the new type to be contained, then you will not be able to
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.html#pick_and_drop drop on it.
If the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.html#pick_and_drop pick and drop completed successfully, then you should have a new set of objects matching the structure of the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.html#component component .
2Deleting a component
To remove a
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.html#component component from your EiffelBuild system,
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.html#pick_and_drop pick it, and then
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.html#pick_and_drop drop it on
/images/eiffelbuild/icons/icon_delete_small_color.png in the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/10_general_interface_description/20_main_toolbars.xml main toolbar .
Note: The deletion of a
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.html#component component can not be undone.
2Viewing a component
To view an existing component, use the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/65_component_viewer/index.xml component_viewer .
